description: Life was meant for great adventures (Trip) and good friends (Oppo). Like a friendly dolphin, TripOppo is the most intimate friend of the guests. Whether you're looking to make new friends or reconnect with your loved ones, you will enjoy the worry-free journey full of friendly atmosphere, and experience the most authentic culture!

reviews.title: In the beginning, customer service was shaky but improved and trip was good
text: 10/23 - The customer service with TripOppo is very poor. For a company that is in the travel industry, they should be more attentive and responsive with their customers; especially since it is the customers who are keeping them in business.
It is like pulling teeth to get answers to questions or inquire on next steps. If the customer does not take the initiative to follow up on their inquiry, TripOppo will not get back.
If this is what customer service is like now before payment, what will happen once TripOppo receives full payment.
Do better; you are not the only fish in the sea.
Update 5/24:  Trip to Japan was good and itinerary gave a good overview of visiting cities and highlights

reviews.title: TripOppo: a Terrific Resource, but Stay Alert!
text: Now finalizing arrangements for my third trip with TripOppo (formerly Nexus), so I feel I understand some things I would have liked to know before my first. TripOppo offers some of the best bargains in tour packages in every corner of the world, and for that reason their services are invaluable -- even irreplaceable -- for the budget traveler.
There is a downside to this, however:

1. TripOppo does not actually arrange or book the tours it offers, it achieves its competitive prices by brokering packages offered in the host nations. (Therefore the company's knowledge of its offerings is third hand and sometimes vague.)

2. TripOppo is an international Chinese company that has a Canadian office and quotes in Canadian dollars, which is great. But staff language skills for conducting business in English are not adequate. (Therefore communications can be puzzling or questionable.)

3. TripOppo can sometimes make decisions based on cost that are against the interest of passengers. (Therefore twice they have booked me on international flights that required checking out of a hotel at 3:00AM. The second time I caught it in time and refused.)

4. With so many fingers in so many pies across the world, the left hand never seems to know what the right hand is doing. (Once I waited eleven months for them to refund a canceled excursion and finally had to remind them; they did it immediately. And from one communication to the next, even with the booking number in front of them, they cannot recall whether I have paid in full and keep sending forms that I have already completed.)

What this means is that the tourist must take a larger share than usual of avoiding misunderstandings and ensuring that all the details of the tour are completed in a legal and acceptable fashion. Nevertheless, the range of offerings, the competitive prices, and the use of Canadian funds, make this company an essential resource for any Canadian budget traveler. After all, I'm going back for my third tour!

reviews.title: Disappointed - Not Recommended at all
text: Realy disappointed of what this company with Bravatour are offering.
We visited  morocco beautiful and wonderful country highly recommended.  But,

Tripoppo and Bravatour not poeple to trust,  we should complain about many situations with the hotel in Ouarzazate or Medilt...etc we did not care about it. But, when it comes to to our own tips for our drivers and guide we can not tolerate it. We were over charge by the company lots lots money,

Our Guide Abdul( Abdelhadi) respectful person, very funny, welcoming,  knowledgeable...etc

reviews.title: Morocco Bus Trip
text: Very disappointed with this tour company.   Wrong info given or no info given during tours.   Tour guide in Morocco for 10 days was lovely man but no skills on how to manage stops or get people back on the bus on time.   Most hotels were less than desirable with cockroaches in several peoples rooms.  Tours were late arriving, or cancelled last minute.  Several disgruntled people on the tour Contacted tour company but were given feeble replies and they took no responsibility for anything.  People who had used this company previously and were happy agreed they would never travel with them any more.  Not recommended.  Have travelled the world and this was the worst organized ever.

reviews.title: Tripoppo travel agency
text: Had to cancel due to health issues . TripOppo didn't refund me 50% eligible amount according to their policy.  I received only 782$ which was for optional tours and gratuities.  I managed to get only 300$ for a trip that cost me 5,000$. I will never use this travel agency again. TripOppo used to be called Nexus.  Recommend reading reviews.

reviews.title: Tripoppo
text: Did back to back tours, Turkey and Greece then Croatia, Slovenia and Bosnia
First tour was excellent with same guide for whole trip. Guide was very knowledgable and had excellent English.
Second trip had a few disappointments:
tour co-ordinator did not have a good grasp of English, hard to understand.
Several things were changed and not what we paid for.
Local guides were all excellent.
Overall a good trip.

reviews.title: Excellent Tour
text: We have enjoyed every moment of our Egypt tour provided by Tripoppo.  Everything that the tour promised was fulfilled. The hotels exceeded our expectations. The food quality and rooms were amazing. The tour guides are professional and attentive.

reviews.title: 9 day trip to Japan
text: For the price this tour meets expectations.  What passes for a four star hotel in Japan is lower standard than we are used to. Japanese food is not to our taste and the breakfasts were not good. Food that should be hot but is served barely lukewarm is unpleasant. The optional Keisaki dinner served in Osaka was an expensive disaster and if the hotel can’t offer a decent meal for $90 US it should be removed from the itinerary. There are long spells on the bus and a short ride on the Bullet train of 15 minutes. Considering all the time wasted to get to the station and hanging about there, it wasn’t worth bothering. Too many temples and shrines and not enough time seeing more local colour such as market.  Any lunch meal was rushed and we were given very little shopping time. Guides were good and the buses comfortable. Anyone planning this tour should lower their expectations regarding food and hotel accommodation.

reviews.title: Rhine river cruise needs new ship
text: We joined Tripoppo with friends at the beginning of September for a 7 day River cruise of the Rhine and an additional 2 days in Lucerne. It is a beautiful area to visit and I can say that overall the trip was well organized with flights and the daily excursions in the cities along the Rhine. It is a great time to travel with less tourists and good weather. We were told that it was a 5 star ship and it was most definitely not. It was old and tired with a very poor air conditioning system. With above average temperatures, we were given fans to try to cool off the rooms but it was still warm. We heard it was being redone after our cruise but it should have not been used by Tripoppo if they promote a 5 star standard. Generally, the service on the Crucevida ship was good and the crew was courteous and always willing to help. The food was good and well presented. Bigger appetites could be accommodated by ordering larger amounts but we were only told on 3rd day. This must be clarified on day 1. No gym or evening activities were available. Our stay in Lucerne was in a great location with easy access to the main attractions but unfortunately was not air conditioned. I understand that Switzerland is usually cool at this time of year but with global warming it is imperative they hotels be air conditioned. We were given fans but not to much avail. Tripoppo can easily improve this package by making just a few modifications.

reviews.title: Rhine River Cruise on Cruvevita
text: Although they rate this as A 5 star, it definitely isn’t, the ship needs a refurbishment and very little was included.  Air conditioning worked sporadically and although our voucher said double bed we received 2 small Murphy beds.  No drinks other than water, tea or coffee were included unless you bought the bar package, which we thought was for all aboard but wasn’t.
We will never book with them again, which from talking to other travellers, neither would they.

reviews.title: EGYPT & JORDAN
text: I travelled with Nexus Holidays to Egypt/Jordan in November/2019. It was an adventure of a lifetime! The history, the people , cruising the Nile and the experience of floating in the Dead Sea were amazing ! The trip was first class for an amazing price. I have travelled with Nexus Holidays to China, Thailand, India and Dubai and every trip was Excellent! I would highly recommend Nexus Holidays ! HELEN GAUDET. HALIFAX

reviews.title: Fascinating Peru-the Amazon with Machu Picchu---TRULY AMAZING
text: An amazing experience!!! We worked with April out of the Vancouver office. She was very efficient, pleasant and accomodating. Everything was arranged for us--flights, airport transfers, hotels, tours and excursions, Inca trail train tickets, entrance fees into all major sites,  even seat selection. We asked for an extra two nights in Lima and that was taken care of too, along with tours. The hotels that Nexus had chosen were great, the luxury Amazon lodge truly was luxury in the jungle. The setting, food, accommodations, excursions and guides there were terrific. The tour company, Izi Amigos, that Nexus paired us with in Peru was fabulous. The service provided by Luis Orlando and his guides was outstanding. I highly recommend them!!!  We were met at each location by knowledgeable and very pleasant guides. The sites that we went to see were fantastic. We were escorted to all the airports, Ricardo in Lima and Dennis in Cusco even stayed with us through check in and into  security. What amazing personable service!! We were even treated to a most special and fun evening at Luis' home. We were sad to leave our new friends. This was truly an fascinating trip because of the history, culture and experiencing the incredible Machu Picchu and Sacred Valley.  The arrangements made by Nexus and the services provided by Izi Amigos made the trip amazing.

reviews.title: Appalling lack of support from Nexus Holidays
text: We booked this trip last summer and embarked on our China Wonders 12 Days holiday early last November, with a 3-day add-on to Hong Kong at the end of the journey.

I have to admit that I had my suspicions, especially at such a low price.  You're getting what you pay for.  For example, their "4 and 5 Star Hotels" are nothing more than 2-3 Star hotel by North American or European standards.  Comfortable, but positively not luxurious.  The same would apply to the food, mostly buffet-style restaurants with Chinese food that mostly tasted similar to what you'd get here in Canada.

The sites are incredible to see but didn't get to spend near enough time at such venues as The Great Wall or The Terra Cotta Warriors and Horses Museum.  We spent a lot of time on buses being ferried from site to site.  They certainly don't rush you at places like the Tea Plantation or the Silk Factory, which they try to sell, sell, sell.
Shanghai was my highlight of the trip and would certainly fly back on my own to explore this incredible city more thoroughly.

Nexus Holidays completely fell apart on the add-on part of our trip to Hong Kong.  Granted, there were all the protests going on at that time, but we didn't have transport to our hotel waiting for us at the airport and the phone numbers for contacts they provided us didn't work.  We paid ourn transport which Nexus did compensate us for.  Our hotel for very close to the protest area, and we genuinely feared for our safety.  Not once to Nexus contact us to see how we were doing.  A tour of Hong Kong the following day included an unplanned for "shopping stop" at a jewellery wholesaler, which ticked everyone on the bus.  A prepaid trip to Macau was a debacle as the taxi taking us to the ferry was very late arriving at the hotel.  We missed our scheduled ferry trip by 45 minutes, then were told that they "couldn't guarantee our safety" in the return ferry trip as the ferry terminal was a Ground Zero of the anti-government protests.  We wisely decided to cancel this part of the trip, after communicating with someone in Nexus's Vancouver office.

When we finally returned, we gave our honest feedback to our contact in the Markham office and asked for compensation for both the taxis in Hong Kong and the Macau trip.  Emails to their office went generally unanswered or took weeks to answer with such excuses as "it's the holidays".  Finally, Nexus refused to compensate for any part of our cancelled Macau trip (6 people) which is quite expensive.

We've used several other tour companies and never had such a bad experience.  I've read other peoples' experiences with Nexus and think perhaps part of the problem was a tour organizer (who'll go unnamed).

I give Nexus a poor rating as opposed to a terrible rating due to the quality of the sites you get to see and the generally take good care of you in China (save and except our tour leader in Beijing).  My recommendation to anyone looking to book anything with Nexus is consider a more expensive and reputable tour operator.  I could never in good conscience recommend this tour company.

reviews.title: Egypt, Nile River Cruise, and Jordon 15 Days
text: We set out from Toronto October 2019. After a long flight we headed out to see the pyramids as soon as we had our baggage. At the pyramids we also saw the Great Sphinx of Giza and had unique experience of riding a camel. We were surprised to see how close the city has encroached towards the pyramids.
Our tour guide Emad was very knowledgeable and passionate about Egyptian history All the temples we seen travelling to the Nile Cruise and while on the cruise were something we’ll never forget.
The Nile portion was excellent. The crew, food and the overall experience was top notch.
The evening light show at the Pyramids should not be missed.
We were disappointed in the cleanliness and state of many of the buildings in Cairo. The hotel in Cairo before and after the Nile Cruise is remote and not much to do around it.
Jordon was a unique experience and Amman as a whole was more modern than we expected.
Don’t miss the Jeep ride in Wadi Rum, it was breathtaking. The hotel in Petra was unbelievable with each suite having thick walls and a “Flintstone” type experience
The tour of Petra was the highlight of the holiday. So much to see, you could spend days there.
The resort at the Dead Sea was beautiful. The property was tiered and you could venture right to the Dead Sea. And a swim in the highly salted water was an experience we will never forget.
Jay our local guide throughout Jordon was very enthusiastic, knowledgeable and very much an excellent ambassador for his country.
This is the third trip with Nexus Holidays and overall all have been good experiences. Now looking at their Rhine River Cruise.

reviews.title: China Discovery Tour - amazing experience!
text: My wife and I just took our 8 yr old daughter on the China Discovery tour with Nexus and had an incredible experience! Nexus had excellent guides in all the cities, and chose great hotels at each stop. The sights we went to see were fantastic, and it felt like we always spent the right amount of time in each spot. Yes, there are shopping stops where you have to spend a certain amount of time, but in each of those spots, you still get to learn something culturally significant, like learning about jade, pearls, and green tea. The trip also has numerous optional add-ons, which some on our trip didn’t seem to understand. They are certainly optional, but there aren’t really other choices aside from either wandering around the area or sitting on the bus. I cannot emphasize enough how much I recommend that you just do all of optional tours! They were all wonderful, and well worth doing (with the possible exception of the Hangzhou West Lake boat tour, not because it wasn’t great, but just because the lake area is beautiful, and we didn’t get a chance to wander around because we were on the boat).
I’ve been telling everyone who will listen to GO TAKE THIS TRIP! It was a truly new experience for our family, and we were all very sad when it came to an end!

reviews.title: Egypt & Jordan
text: This is the fourth time we have traveled with Nexus previously having spent 26 days in China, visited Viet Nam and Cambodia along with a Rhine cruise last June.  In all instances we have been impressed with the value for money spent and the organization that has gone into maximizing the experience for the traveler.  The optional tours are offered to augment the package and do give options to experience something you may not have thought  about doing.  In our case it was an early morning balloon ride over the Temple of Hatshepsut at 2,000 feet near the Valley of the Kings.
The addition of the Nile Cruise allowed us to experience the essence of Egypt in a way that you cannot via bus or plane.
If you want to experience the history of ancient Egypt this is definitely the way to go.

Nexus thoughtfully added one of their own employees; due to the size of the group (Popsy Chan), as a chaperone, who was great to deal with and smoothed over the minor problems that occur for people who might not have been
comfortable doing so themselves.
Overall it was to coin a cliche "a trip of a lifetime" and will give us memories that will last.

reviews.title: China 17 Day Trip
text: Myself, my wife Susan and our good friends Mike and Joy just returned from our 17 day Nexus trip to China. Booking the trip was very easy with no $$$ surprises (except a last minute day trip to Vancouver for our travel Visas).

Nexus did a great job pacing our guided tour. Our trip started in Shanghai and ended in Beijing; we cruised the Yangtze in the middle. I loved Shanghai, the Yangtze River and the Great Wall; the Pandas were also super special.

Can’t say enough good things about all of our guides; they brought their local knowledge to each location and were able to add facts and colour you couldn’t get from any book. Cherry (who took us to see the Pandas), and Amie (Great Wall and Beijing) were excellent. That said, a special special thanks to our main guide Cheung Chie (Jackie Cheung). He was with us from the very beginning when we flew in (late at night) to Shanghai to the end of our trip to make sure we got to the Beijing airport 17 days later! His professionalism and expertise were only exceeded by his calmness (under all kinds of pressures)...nothing phased him! He really looked after us as a group and individually... there was anything he wasn’t able to make happen for us! Thank you thank you thank you!!!
We would have no problem recommending this trip and Nexus to anyone.

reviews.title: India 2018
text: We had an amazing trip to India with Nexus Holiday. We travel extensively but it was the first with Nexus. It was well organized. We had a national tour guide that stays with us the entire time. The bus was reliable. The driver and his assistant knew the routes. The hotels were as advertised. Not all the meals were included but were efficiently organized. There were added optional tours. If you did not participate, you were on your own. The safari was a joke- save your money, it was not worth it. We did not see any animals other then peacocks that can be seen throughout the country. We were picked up from the airport and brought back as planned. The driver was a blessing when we arrived at the airport. The entire building was so busy with line ups that were concerning. We would never have made our flight if the driver never had connections to advance the line. I would highly recommend Nexus Holidays.

reviews.title: Very impressed by Nexus Holidays
text: My wife and I have just had the pleasure of taking part in a wonderful tour organized by Nexus Holidays.  We booked the 16 day Indochina Tour, this was our first introduction to Nexus Holidays and needless to say it will not be our last.

The professionalism of the organization was stellar and all aspects of the trip were planned to perfection.  Our assigned travel consultant Albee Pei, was extremely helpful and accommodating.    The accommodations and meals were superior, vastly exceeding our expectations. The sites that we visited were very reflective of the local area and they allowed us to develop a true appreciation of the country and people.  Our tour guides were extremely knowledgeable. They were very accommodating to everyone in our tour group and they were able to respond to all questions, whether they were related to geography, religious practices or cultural traits. Their sense of humor, patience and pleasant nature added greatly to our enjoyment of our trip.  In particular our tour guide in central Vietnam, Tuan Nguyen, and our guide in Cambodia, Savutha Mat, went above and beyond.  Both these gentlemen were true professionals and Nexus should be very proud to have individuals such as them representing their company.

In summation, I would like to thank Nexus.  We will be booking another tour with them as soon as we possibly can.  I will also be promoting them and encouraging others to plan their future tours with Nexus Holidays.
Randy Hanson
Winnipeg, Manitoba. Canada

reviews.title: China  Epic really is Epic
text: Everything was so well organized, first rate and a wonderful experience.  We covered all the highlights that you could possibly want to see in 15 days.  Accommodations were fantastic and the guides were superb.  Our main guide was knowledgeable and friendly and each city guide was very knowledgeable.
I highly recommend this trip with Nexus Holidays

reviews.title: Pyramids, Temples, Nile Cruise, Petra and Dead Sea Tour
text: After 2 year delay, finally toured Egypt/Jordan but thanks to Popsy for making this jam pact tour a memorable holiday.  Everything was as promised and more. I would definitely travel with them again

reviews.title: The Wonders of Egypt and Jordan
text: Our sincere thanks to TripOppo for an incredible tour of Egypt and Jordan.  Our trip was delayed for over two years because of Covid, but the eventual result exceeded our expectations.  We will always remember walking through tunnels to the tomb at the centre of the Great Pyramid, riding camels beside the pyramids, cruising the Nile River, taking a sunrise hot-air balloon ride at Luxor, exploring the desert at Wadi Rum, viewing the temples at Abu Simbel, visiting the ancient city of Petra, and enjoying a myriad of other remarkable sights (too many to mention here).  We have no regrets about anything.  It was great value for money.  The tour was a delight from start to finish.  It is our practice to sign up for all of the optional excursions.  What would anyone travel that far and miss out on any of the wondrous sights to be seen?

We were accompanied throughout by Popsy Chan, the TripOppo representative, and she did an amazing job of solving problems and ensuring that everything went smoothly.  To give one small example, when we got back to Toronto, she waited at the baggage carousel until everyone got their luggage and left for home.  As it happened, one tour member's suitcase was mistakenly unloaded in Toronto, but Popsy discovered that problem and remedied it.  Our local guides, Emad in Egypt and Bashar in Jordan, left nothing to be desired.  Each with 30 years of experience, they provided much useful information and advice, spoke excellent English and had highly pleasing personalities.

We had an action-packed two weeks in one of the most exciting places in the world, and we saw first-hand the mind-boggling achievements of these ancient civilizations.  We were almost sorry to return home, but we are left with memories that will be with us forever.
Jeanie and John Ritchie
Toronto, Ontario

reviews.title: Before you book with Nexus Holidays
text: I booked a tour (pre-Covid) through this company and they have yet to refund me my deposit. We are into 2nd year of travel advisory restrictions and they continue our keep my deposit.

We have yet to travel and will not travel with them. I have had to write numerous emails to them, their response has been to wait it out and travel in future years or pay a penalty and they get to keep some of our deposit.

reviews.title: Disgusting treatment of Seniors
text: Please do not have anything to do with this company.

Know a few Seniors who placed a deposit on the Volga River Cruise scheduled for July 2020. It was cancelled to Covid-19, but calls are not being returned, e-mails are not being replied to and no refunds or explanations have been provided.

reviews.title: COVID 19 trip cancelled, no issue to have back our money
text: Our flights, our reservation, everything was done, practically at 100% and 50% maybe a little more was paid to make this beautiful trip to China and Japan.
This was plan for March 2020 with NEXUS HOLIDAYS CANADA but, unfortunately, the Corona Virus/COVID-19 stopped all this beautiful trip with Nexus.
Since March, we were in communication with Candie to be re-embursed, and I could say last week, we received our final payment witch was the deposit.

Candie, I will come back to you and to your agency, you been helping us, for sure a lot of emails, follow up been exchanged and we do understand that those circumstances were not a usual business but THANK YOU TO YOU AND YOUR PEOPLE.
I hope to talk to you in 2021 2022, we will reach NEXUS for sure and this respect of giving us back our money at, 100%, I will never forget.
Thank you and stay safe
Dominique

reviews.title: Indochina Discovery Tour exceeded all expectations
text: We just returned from this tour just in time before airports were shutting down all over Asia due to Covid 19. The hotels in Vietnam, Cambodia and Laos could teach our Western hospitality industry a thing or two.  The tour was so well planned, it was like clockwork.  The guides were amazingly knowledgeable and all spoke good English.  The boat in Halong Bay was first class and the Empress Hotel in Cambodia has no match in the Western World.  It was over the top.  If you are planning to take this tour make sureto take the Laos extension. It is worth while.  Luang Prabang is very beautiful with a relaxing atmosphere. This is the second time we have travelled with Nexus and we would do it again.  They are professionals.

reviews.title: The Egypt, Jordan and Israel Trip was beyond expectations !!!!
text: The trip was a great experience from the beginning to end.  We enjoyed the seamless planning of our trip with each detail looked after.  The guides were amazing providing interesting facts for the advertised must see sights.  Then the guides added special and interesting sights that added to the experience!!.  They provided many well now and unusual facts of history about the locations we visited.  This was truly a trip of a lifetime !!!

reviews.title: Egypt and Jordan
text: Very good experience.  Nexus arrangements of the trip from the beginning to the end was excellent:  Wonderful and historical places to visit/experience, excellent accommodations,  tour guides were very knowledgeable, etc.  I would definitely travel with Nexus again.

reviews.title: Egypt and Jordon
text: If you like/love history, you will love this trip.   Everyday was something interesting, amazing stuff to see.   Egyptian ruins, pyramids, Petra Treasury.  Finishing off swimming in the DEAD Sea or should i say floating.   Our tour guides were excellent, looking after our needs and requests.  Plus we met a group of very nice fellow tourists from all over Canada.

In both countries our family felt very safe.   (yes there were lots of police around with guns.)   allow extra time to go through the Mid East airport screening process.    That said, its there for your safety.

reviews.title: Peru
text: This was absolutely the best trip landing in Lima our guide escorted through the city giving us a great day of sightseeing.He was attentive to our needs,the hotel accomdations were cert rally located easy to find good restaurants and shopping. We proceeded the next day to Inkaterra to enjoy our jungle excursion it was amazing the accomdations and food were top notch.We enjoyed tree top trekking,  excursions in the jungle both day and night looking for wild life. The night cruise on the river was stunning. Thanks staff was attentive,and made our stay awesome.We then proceeded to Cusco and Machu Picchu it was an awesome experience. All the guides were very informative and very attentive to our needs. I would strongly recommend this trip you will not be disappointed. Susan and Bob Horning

reviews.title: Rhine River with Tripoppo
text: Was on the MS Crucevita in Sept 2023 traveling on the Rhine.  The places visited were very nice and the castles along the cruise were spectacular.

However,  the ship was very disappointing.  Ship is old, with many issues, cabin beds and pillows very old,  food was good but very little, no afternoon snacks, entertainment very  poor. The hotel Rothaus  in Lucerne was horrible!, no air conditioning, feel the bed springs. Only good thing within walking distance to centre. Very disappointed with Tripoppo and would not recommend it.

reviews.title: Mysteries of Egypt and Jordan with Nile Cruise
text: Over all we had a great time, but there is room for improvement.

We arrived in Cairo a few days prior to the start of the tour.  We were considered ‘Land Only’ and did not receive copies of the internal flights. We did not discover this until the day before the flight from Cairo to Luxor. More on the flights later.

The Movenpick Hotel was nice and clean but the food was dull and never hot.  I asked the staff to turn on the chafing dishes and was told that the reason the food was cold was because the lids kept being opened.

Our guide Ali was amazing.  He kept his cool even when things went wrong.  He is a wealth of information about Egypt and answered our never ending questions with a smile. The guide in Jordan was not like this. More on that later.

We had early morning starts in order to see everything that Cairo and Egypt has to offer.  This was fine except that the supper meals were served so late.  A diabetic would do very poorly on this tour.
When we flew to Luxor we had a breakfast to go that consisted of stale buns with cheese slices or bologna, a juice box and a piece of fruit. Not delicious but filled the void.
The flight to Luxor saw our group on 3 different flights. This added to the stress in a very confusing airport.  Thankfully there were staff to help all of us.

The cruise boat we were on was called the Royal Princess.  It was old, tired and dirty.  The towels and linens were grey.  The hot tub was not heated and this was disappointing as a hot soak was needed after long days of walking.
The Wi-Fi on board had to be purchased and it rarely worked.
The bars were rarely staffed and this made buying water difficult.
We counted at least 19 boats all traveling to the same places.  This made for crowds that could be avoided if the boats were staggered by a day or 2.
While we were on the boat, Ali helped us get the Jordan QR code.  Ali was very patient with all of us that were not tech savvy.
The air conditioning on the boat was either on full blast and arctic like, or off.  Nothing in between.
Tea time at 4:30 daily was very nice.
Once we arrived in Aswan, it would have been better to leave the boat and go to the Isis Island hotel.
We had limited time at the Valley of the Kings. This was made worse by having to wait 30 minutes for Ali to get the tickets.  Couldn’t this be done in advance?

In Aswan, we took horse drawn carriages.  These poor horses were abused with whips, had open sores, visible ribs and were frothing at the mouth due to being forced to run, not trot.  This was absolutely disgusting and Tripoppo should not be encouraging the use of these horses. Half the group took a taxi back to the boat. A taxi or tuk tuk would be appropriate.
The majority of our group went to Abu Simbel in an old run down bus.  A flight would have been better.
Everywhere we went served instant Nescafe! Yuck!

When we flew back to Cairo, we were on 2 different flights this time.  We then got on an old bus to drive in circles to get to TGI Fridays for lunch.  At least an hour was wasted and the driver would not listen to Ali.  He made frightening U-turns and drove backwards on a major highway. This man should never be allowed to drive! The meal at Fridays was ok but not delicious.  I think it would be better to just stay at the airport for lunch.
We enjoyed Ali very much and loved the head sets that he used.   He worked very hard and had a great sense of humour.
The Land Mark Hotel in Amman was fabulous but we were not there long enough to enjoy it. The food was delicious and hot!

For people that did not do the optional jeep tour were not given an alternative and had to sit in a restaurant or the bus for 2 hours.  The only option for lunch was a buffet that was expensive. When lunch is not provided, there should be a couple of places to choose from.
The hotel in Petra was old and run down.  It felt like the dining room was in a cave. Thankfully the air conditioning worked.  Dry, cold food again.

Our guide was named Omar.  He did not carry a flag and did not use a head set.  He would begin talking before everyone in the group was present and would act annoyed when asked a question.  He actually ‘shushed’ a lady.  He did not do this to men.  When he spoke, he would have his back to us and would face the thing he was talking about. This made it impossible to hear him.  Most just gave up and walked away. Not everyone on our tour was Christian and Omar spoke as if we all had knowledge of the Bible.  On more than 1 occasion he tried to get us to buy his book.  Shameless self promotion!

The Crown Plaza at the Dead Sea was not a 5 star as promised.  I can’t believe that Crown Plaza's name is associated with is hotel. The rooms were dirty,  A/C did not work and was told that it was winter and would not be turned on.  We had no hot water and when Omar was told about these problems, he did nothing.  The food was ok and hot.
I hope this helps the next people who take this trip,
Shelli Saunders

reviews.title: Peru & Bolivia
text: Once again our expectations were exceeded both in Peru and the optional additional extension to Bolivia  leaving Oct 22 and returning Nov 7.  Peru has a developed tourist industry which has not reached the same level in Bolivia consequently transit between destinations primarily by vehicles is necessary.  Food in both countries was first rate both in presentation and variety.  Hotels were exceptional, planning and logistics were flawless.  Scenery in Bolivia cannot be described since it is spectacular.  The salt flats at Uyuni in Bolivia covering 10,000 square miles has to be seen.  The archaeological sites in both countries are spectacular for anyone interested in history.   All the guides were knowledgeable, attentive and made the trip special.  Only problems were with altitude as some locations 14,360 feet above sea level.
Our thanks to Luis Orlando, Liz and all the personnel at TripOppo that made this trip so memorable.

reviews.title: 15 Day Egypt and Jordan Tour with TripOppo
text: Hotel facilities and meals were all 5 star and food (buffet) was excellent. The 5 day river cruise on Grand Princess was ok as ship was showing its age but rooms were clean though a little worn. Ship buffet was good. Tours in eqypt and jordon were as advertised. There was lots of time to experience the history of the area. Favorite tours included pyramids, camel rides, wadi rum Jeep tour and hot air balloon ride. Our Tour Leader Robert was exceptional. He made sure all travel connections air, boat and bus went off without a hitch.  We hope that Robert will be our tour leader in future tours with TripOppo. Goid job Robert.

reviews.title: Mysteries of Egypt and Jordan with Nile Cruise Tour
text: Went on the Sept 22nd tour and had an amazing time. The tour guide, Emad Enan, was very enthusiastic and engaging and made us feel like family. He took very good care of us and was always very professional and organized. Our schedule was hectic but he was always able to suggest small changes to make things flow smoother. I highly recommend Tripoppo, this tour and Emad as a guide. Looking forward to another journey with Tripoppo in the future!

reviews.title: Rhine River Cruise & Lucerne
text: Recently completed a 12 day Rhine River cruise with extension in Lucerne Switzerland. The Cruciveta boat was excellent and food offered was plentiful and tasty. Included city tours had experienced and passionate and knowledgeable guides. Scenery along the River was great! All cities visited has incredible history and architecture!

All transfers, transportation and anything else organized by Trippo was flawless. Hotel in Lucerne had no lobby area for our travel group of 8 to sit and socialize. It was however a great location very close to the old town centre and the Lion Monument.
This was our 4th trip with Tripoppo (formerly Nexus) and we are looking forward to our Peru trip with them in 2023
Tom & Joanne

reviews.title: Turkey
text: Our tour of Turkey was amazing, we had a fantastic tour guide, who was very knowledgeable about all the areas that we visited.  Everything was fantastic from the food, the bus driver, the hotels and all the locations that we stopped at.  I highly recommend this tour!
